page.title: 17ASPECTS OF LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: To the south of Wyken Slough it is possible to see the remains of an old mineral railway.There are also several low,grass-covered spoil heaps from old mines. The{Walsgrave History Project}team (based at Walsgrave C.E.School) are cataloging information concerning the mining history as some families whose members were local colliers still live in the area. A walking trail has been prepared by the{Coventry Museums.} Another reminder of this era is the name of the B4109,{Parrots Grove}as it passes through {Aldermans Green}. Richard Parrot,being a coal owner whose home,Hawkesbury Hall can be seen on the road's north side just beyond the city boundary.
